title: Is it true that Hitler offered to release Stalin’s son in exchange of Paulus, who was regarded a traitor for being captured? - Quora

response.answer_text: Indeed it is — too which Stalin is said to have replied to his associates with him when he read of the offer :- “Who would exchange a Field Marshall for a Lieutenant” ????? Not sure that Stalin regarded his son as a traitor — he is said to have remarked to a fellow member of the Stavka “Yakov will not betray his Motherland.” But of course the same views would not have been held by many Russians who considered that anyone who did not ‘go down fighting’ was a traitor. That they had nothing to fight with, were without rations and supplies of every kind against overwhelming numbers had no bearing on their assessment.
